Sentence: Upon her (Louie) return to her (Louie) childhood home, Pearl's Auntie Helen, Bao-Bao's mother, who co-owns a flower shop with Pearl's mother, pulls Pearl aside and makes a request
Auntie Helen tells Pearl that Pearl must tell her (Helen) mother Winnie about Pearl's multiple sclerosis, which everyone in the family knows about, except for Winnie
Helen says that Pearl must do this because Helen believes that Helen has a malignant brain tumor and does not want to die knowing that Winnie does not know this about her (Winnie) daughter
Also, by the end of the novel, Helen reveals the planning of a trip to China--a trip that Helen, Pearl, and Winnie will take together
